meanings.definition: The act of making something or someone brutal.
meanings.sent1: The brutalization of the wild animal made it dangerous.
meanings.sent2: The brutalization of the criminal was evident in his violent actions.
meanings.sent3: The brutalization of the cake batter resulted in a tough and chewy dessert.
meanings.sent4: The brutalization of the landscape by the storm left a path of destruction.
meanings.sent5: The brutalization of the soldiers during training toughened them up for battle.

meanings.sent1: The gradual brutalization of the peaceful society was alarming.
meanings.sent2: The brutalization of the young man changed his gentle nature.
meanings.sent3: The brutalization of the teddy bear's appearance made it look fierce.
meanings.sent4: The brutalization of the weather turned a sunny day into a stormy one.
meanings.sent5: The brutalization of the plant caused it to develop thorns for protection.

meanings.sent1: The victim's brutalization left deep emotional scars.
meanings.sent2: The brutalization of the prisoners in the jail was a serious issue.
meanings.sent3: The brutalization of the toy car made it look like it had been in a crash.
meanings.sent4: The brutalization of the fabric gave it a worn and rugged appearance.
meanings.sent5: The brutalization of the environment by pollution harmed the wildlife.
